alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Jefferson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson, Shawnee, eastern Wabaunsee, eastern Pottawatomie, southeastern Nemaha, Jackson and southern Brown Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1150 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Havensville to near Eskridge. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Holton, Hiawatha, Horton, Valley Falls, Rossville, Oskaloosa, Eskridge, Tecumseh, St. Marys, Dover, Silver Lake, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Hoyt, Ozawkie, Nortonville, Lecompton and Maple Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 335 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 172 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Jackson; Jefferson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
